intro: Bursaria lasiophylla var. parvifolia, commonly known as the small-leaved bursaria, is a shrub native to Australia. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its small, oval leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in racemes, followed by spherical, woody fruits. It is typically found in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. The species is of interest in ecological studies due to its role in local ecosystems and its resilience to environmental stress.
